Pre-Game Insights: Iceland will be aiming to start their 2024-25 UEFA Nations League campaign with a victory when they welcome Montenegro.
Iceland finished second in Group 2 of League B last time out, while Montenegro were third in Group 3 of the same division in their last Nations League campaign.
Iceland failed to qualify for Euro 2024, losing 2-1 to Ukraine in their playoff final back in March.
Iceland's immediate attention will be on the Nations League, as they prepare to take on Montenegro, Turkey and Wales in this particular section.
Montenegro finished third in their qualification section for Euro 2024, with the team therefore absent from the finals of the recent European Championship.
Robert Prosinecki's side were beaten twice by Belgium and Georgia in friendlies at the start of June, but they did win their opening two fixtures of the year against Belarus and North Macedonia.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Iceland's last match was a 4-0 defeat to the Netherlands in a friendly on June 10.
Montenegro's last match was a 3-0 win over Romania in June 2022.
